result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Cline Smith II

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF343, 22CF36, 22CF57, 22CF414, and 22CF192. State notes that no victims plan to attend the hearings today. In 22CF343, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests a status. Attorney Rosenthal notes that the defendant just finished an assessment in Duluth. There is a joint request for another status.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:17 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal states defendant on wait for assessment and asks for another status in October. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:13 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases. in 22CF192, acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accept pleas.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. In 22CF141, Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty pleas. Attorney Rosenthal asks for status in 45 days and asks for bail modification hearing next week. Court also sets bail/bond hearing on 22CF192. Attorney Rosenthal asks for a waiver of preliminary hearing on 22CF192. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court binds over for arraignment.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:30 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith II in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Christopher Cline Smith II.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case.  Court indicates no information filed in 22CF57.  Receives information in 22CF36, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Asks for status. Waives times limits in 22CF57 for filing of information.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
09:17 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith in court and not in-custody with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls the case. State calls witness, Officer Sislo.  State-direct examination of witness. On 01-10-22 at approximately 11:00 pm, in the City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin is where the incident occurred. Witness identifies Defendant. Court notes for the record Defendant has been identified. Attorney Rosenthal cross examines witness. State rests. Attorney Rosenthal rests for defense. State makes argument for bind over. Attorney Rosenthal makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment.  Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice. Court will reset STC in case 22CF57 to trail this case. 
  Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
1500.00 reinstated; must post additional 500.00; conditions of no contact with victim #1

Court recalls the case at 9:45; defendant appears; warrant quashed based on appearance
Atty Rosenthal-client returned his phone call promptly and showed up; confusion about the court date/time; his intent was to have a contested preliminary hearing
Court-reviews the court file; 
State-late appearance is implied waiver of time limits
Court-Preliminary hearing 3-2-22 at 8:30
State-request 250.00 increase of bail
Atty Rosenthal-alread posted 1500.00; substantial local ties to the area; 
Court-questions how much client can post today; court is inclined to order additional bail
Court-reinstates cash bail and orders addtional 500.00 cash bail
Defendant-was trying to see his children this morning and apologizes to the court; request 150.00 additional and someone is coming that may be able to post additional
Court-warns of the importance of attending court; orders additional 500.00 cash bail

08:46 AM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith not in court.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Rosenthal-no information as to why client is not present
State request warrant and bail forf.
Court-so ordered; WI and MN
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Cline Smith II
Current: 1001 N 17th St. Apt 1, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 02-09-2022)
Prior: c/o Douglas County Jail, 1310 N. 14th Street, Superior, WI 54880
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key
No contact with victim 1   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.

01:38 PM Defendant Christopher Cline Smith in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Christopher Cline Smith in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Cline Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Court will set for PH.   States request on bail: $1500 cash bail with conditions of   No contact with victim 1 as listed in the ID Key,   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. State indicates there is a felony probation in Minnesota. State also give prior criminal history and mostly in Wisconsin. Probation violation in 2021 in Minnesota. 
Atty Hoffman speaks with Defendant. Defendant offers statement to the Court. Defendant indicates his family lives here. He makes plea to the Court about lessening bond amount. 
Court asks if there is any amount of money. Defendant can probably post $500
Court Orders $1500 cash bail with conditions of  No contact with victim 1   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.
Atty Hoffman indicates defendant does qualify.
Text message reminder will be sent to the Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
